title: Barclays Move Leads to Wild Swings in Volatility Product
sub_head: Unusual trading in $900 million ETN came a day after bank’s announcement
body:
A big exchange-traded product tracking Wall Street’s “fear gauge” has been swinging wildly this week after Barclays PLC said it would stop supporting the asset.
The $900 million known as VXX, soared as much as 45% intraday Tuesday before paring its gains to close down 0.4% to $28.70. It was halted at least five times in a frenetic trading session. On Wednesday, it shed 9.6% to $25.95.
